Model Context Protocol

Evolution Roadmap: 2024 - 2025

Tracking the rapid advancement of MCP from its foundational release to the cognitive bridging of the future. A journey through four pivotal updates.

Why Context Matters

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) serves as the standard for how Large Language Models (LLMs) interface with external data, memory, and environment. Between late 2024 and late 2025, the protocol underwent a radical transformation, moving from simple state management to complex, multi-modal cognitive bridging. This infographic breaks down that evolution.

Release Chronology

Nov 05, 2024

Foundation

Initial protocol definition. Standardization of context injection hooks.

Mar 26, 2025

Velocity

Compression algorithms introduced. Latency reduced by 40%.

Jun 18, 2025

Nexus

Multi-modal context bridge (Audio/Video support). Cross-app persistence.

Nov 25, 2025

Cognition

Recursive memory architectures. "Infinite" context simulation.
